urlText: L2 and L3 partial line closures and extra early morning L1, L2, L3 services during Sydney Marathon
content:
Due to major road closures in the city and South East on Sunday 15 September for Sydney Marathon, L2 and L3 light rail services will be impacted throughout the day.
 
Additional early morning services will run from 3.45am on all light rail lines.
 
Services changes, Sunday 15 September:
  • L2 Randwick Line:
    • From 3.45am to 10am L2 services will run between Randwick and Town Hall only. Services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall.
    • From 10am, full L2 services between Circular Quay and Randwick will resume as normal.
  • L3 Kingsford Line:
    • From 3.45am to 6am L3 services will run between Juniors Kingsford and Town Hall only. Services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall.
    • From 6am to 10am L3 services will run between Moore Park and Town Hall only. Services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall or between Moore Park and Juniors Kingsford.
    • From 10am to 12pm L3 services will run between Moore Park and Circular Quay only. Services will not run between Moore Park and Juniors Kingsford.
    • From 12pm services resume as normal operating between Circular Quay and Juniors Kingsford in both directions.
When L2 and L3 services are partially closed between Circular Quay and Town Hall, use alternative transport including trains or walking if able to.
 
When L3 services are partially closed between Moore Park and Juniors Kingsford, use alternative transport including L2 Randwick Line services instead. Due to the Sydney Marathon road closures in the Kensington and Kingsford areas, light rail replacement buses will not be operate.
 
Allow plenty of extra travel time as services will be busy. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport information.
subtitle: L2 and L3 partial line closures and extra early morning L1, L2, L3 services during Sydney Marathon

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the Sydney CBD are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2pm route 440 services will be split into two routes between Bondi Junction and Woolloomooloo, and between Rozelle and the city (St James Station).
  • Rozelle-City: Buses from Rozelle will end trips at St James Station, Elizabeth St, Stand C (200057). Buses towards Rozelle will start trips from Museum Station, Elizabeth St Stand C (200073)
  • Bondi Jct-City: Buses from Bondi Junction towards the city will end trips at Riley St opp Kenndey St (201157). Buses towards Bondi Junction will start trips from Crown St at Robinson St (2010100).
Continue on foot between Woolloomooloo and Town Hall for connecting buses between Rozelle and Bondi, alternatively consider catching trains to Bondi instead.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.
subtitle: Sydney CBD diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Special Events Friday 30 August
content:
Special Events Friday 30 August

NRL: Panthers v Rabbitohs - BlueBet Stadium, Penrith
NSW Cup 17:35 to 19:30
NRL 20:00 to 22:00
- The closest station to the stadium is Penrith on the T1 Western Line. It is a 10 minutes walk from the station.
- Please note, weeknight trackwork is taking place on the T1 Western Line from 22:50pm. Buses will replace trains between Emu Plains and St Marys.

NRL: Bulldogs v Sea Eagles - Accor Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park
18:00 to 19:45
- Valid pre-purchased tickets to the NRL match include travel on Sydney Trains, Sydney Bus, Sydney Metro and Light Rail services.

aespa - Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney Olympic Park
19:00 to 22:00
- The closest station to the events is Olympic Park.
- Trains run regularly to Lidcombe where you can head to Platform Zero for a direct train to Olympic Park, running every 10 minutes until late.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2024/08

urlText: Station Update - Parramatta
content:
From Monday 18 August to end-October 2024, one of the escalators servicing platforms 2 and 3 (western end) to the concourse will be closed for replacement. You will be able to use the other escalators, stairs and the lift to enter/exit the platforms. If you arriving on platform 2 at Parramatta Station it is recommended to use the rear 5 carriages.

From Monday 18 August to 28 August 2024 the thoroughfare connecting Westfields Shopping Centre and Parramatta Square will be closed from 08:00pm to 05:00am. 

Please follow staff directions and signage to detour through the station to access Paramatta Square or Westfield Shopping Centre. 

Extra staff will be onsite during this time. If you need assistance, ask station staff, or call 02 9848 9387.

content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2.30pm route 333 services will operate between Bondi Beach and Kings Cross only. Buses will not continue to Circular Quay.
 
Buses towards the city from Bondi will end trips at Bayswater Rd near Kellett St (201162). Buses towards Bondi will start trips from Kings Cross Station, Bayswater Rd, Stand D (201115).
 
Change at Bondi Junction station for trains towards Martin Place/Circular Quay instead.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route
content:
From Sunday 24 September, route M92 Parramatta to Sutherland will be split into two new routes:
  • 920 Parramatta-Bankstown
  • 960 Bankstown-Sutherland
Passengers travelling the full length of the route (Parramatta to Sutherland), will need to change buses at Bankstown.
  • 920 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand E
  • 960 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand B
All other stops remain the same.
 
For more information see the news story.
 
This change will improve journey time and reliability for passengers and will allow drivers to complete other routes impacted by driver shortages.
 
Plan your trip with Trip Planner or transport apps before you travel.

urlText: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival
content:
Sunday 8 September
  • From 12.01am to 11.59pm, route 805 buses will be diverting around a section of Railway Parade and missing stops due to road closures for the Cabramatta Moon Festival event.
  • Services will start and end their trips at a temporary bus stop on Railway Parade between McBurney Road and Hughes Street.
  • Services travelling to Cabramatta will be diverting via Park Road and Hughes Street to the temporary stop on Railway Parade. Services travelling from Cabramatta will start trips from the temporary stop on Railway Parade then travel via its normal route.
  • Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time. Visit the Cabramatta Moon Festival event page for more details.
Missed and alternative stops
  • Arthur West Cabramatta Community Hall, McBurney Rd (216669) will close.
    – Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at McBurney Rd (2166263)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Pde, Stand E (216671) will close.
    – Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at McBurney Rd (2166263)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Pde, Stand A (2166249) will close.
    |– Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at McBurney Rd (2166263)
subtitle: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival

urlText: Sydney CBD and South East diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst Moore Park and Kingsford are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 12.30pm route 370 buses will be split into two routes – between Glebe and Kensington, and between Coogee and Randwick Junction.
  • Glebe-Kensington: Buses leaving Glebe will end trips at Todman Ave at Balfour Rd, Kensington (203345). Buses towards Glebe will start trips from Todman Ave at Balfour Rd (203332). Catch L2 Randwick light rail services to the city for faster connections towards the Inner West.
  • Coogee-Randwick: Buses from Coogee will leave as normal, ending trips at Belmore Rd, Randwick Junction. Buses towards Coogee will leave from Belmore Rd at Avoca St Randwick (2031158). Catch L2 Randwick light rail services to the city for faster connections towards the Inner West.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

content:

urlText: Sydney CBD and South East diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst Moore Park and Kingsford are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2.30pm services will run between Marrickville and Surry Hills only, buses will not run between Bondi Junction and Darlinghurst.
 
Buses from Marrickville will end trips on Cleveland St at Crown St (201047). Buses that usually start from Bondi Jct will start trips from Cleveland St at Marriott St (201636).
 
Go to Central to connect with trains towards Bondi Junction, or catch route 333 buses from Kings Cross station.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Bomaderry and Wollongong, and some trains between Sutherland and Hurstville
content:
Saturday 7 and Sunday 8 September
  • Buses replace trains between Bomaderry and Wollongong.
  • Trains run between Port Kembla, Wollongong and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.
  • Buses do not run to the train timetable. If you are connecting with trains at Wollongong you may need to catch an earlier bus to ensure you meet your train connection.

  • Sunday from 4am to 10am, buses also replace trains between Sutherland and Hurstville.
  • Trains run between South Coast Line stations and Sutherland, some to a changed timetable. T4 trains run between Hurstville and Bondi Junction.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
61SC Bomaderry, then all stations to Kiama, then express to Wollongong and return
62SC Kiama, then all stations to Wollongong and return
 
Sunday morning only

urlText: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival
content:
Sunday 8 September
  • From 12.01am to 11.59pm, route 817 buses will be diverting around a section of Railway Parade and missing stops due to road closures for the Cabramatta Moon Festival event.
  • Services will start and end their trips at a temporary bus stop on Railway Parade between McBurney Road and Hughes Street.
  • Services travelling to Cabramatta will be diverting via McBurney Road, Park Road and Hughes Street to the temporary stop on Railway Parade. Services travelling from Cabramatta will start trips from the temporary stop on Railway Parade then travel via its normal route.
  • Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time. Visit the Cabramatta Moon Festival event page for more details.

  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Parade, Stand E (216671) – Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at McBurney Road (2166263)

urlText: Parramatta Rd - Burwood, permanent bus stop closures
content:

From 4am Monday, 4 April 2022
  • Parramatta Rd before Burwood Rd (213412) will be closed.
    The alternative stop for 415, 461X, 461N and 530 services will be Burwood Rd at Esher Lane (213431).
  • Parramatta Rd after Burwood Rd (213722) will be closed.
    The alternative stop for 415, 416X, 461N and 530 services will be Burwood Rd before Parramatta Rd (213462).

From 6am Monday 4 April 2022:
  • Parramatta Rd before Burwood Rd (213412) will be closed.
    Customers for the N70, N71, N80 and N81 services should use the new stop on Parramatta Rd, after Burwood Rd (213460).
  • Parramatta Rd after Burwood Rd (213722) will be closed.
    Customers for the N70, N71, N80 and N81 towards City Town Hall should use the alternate stop on Parramatta Rd opp Neichs Pde (213721).

urlText: Sydney CBD & North Sydney diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 3.30am to 9.30am buses will start and end trips in Crows Nest instead of the city or North Sydney/Milsons Point.
 
Buses will end trips at Crows Nest Station, Pacific Hwy (206515), buses will start trips from Pacific Hwy opp Crows Nest Station Crows Nest (206530).
 
Stops will be missed on Sussex St, York St, Miller St, Falcon St, Blues Point Rd, Lavender St, North Sydney Station and Milsons Point Station.
 
Catch metro services between Crows Nest and the city to continue your trip.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Dapto, Port Kembla and Sutherland
content:
Saturday 14 September
  • From 3am to 11am, buses replace trains between Dapto, Port Kembla and Sutherland.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Bomaderry, Kiama and Dapto, and T4 Illawarra trains run between Sutherland and Bondi Junction.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Milsons Point and North Sydney diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 12pm route 230 services will run between Mosman Wharf and St Leonards only. Buses will not make stops at North Sydney Station or Milsons Point.
 
Services towards North Sydney will end trips at St Leonards Station, Pacific Hwy, Stand C.
 
Services towards Mosman will start trips from Crows Nest Station, Pacific Hwy (206515), then continue towards Neutral Bay (Big Bear shopping centre).
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: Trains run to a changed timetable. Buses replace some trains
content:
Saturday 7 and Sunday 8 September  
  • Daily until 8am, trains run between Berowra and Central, platforms 1-12, to a reduced frequency, every 30 minutes.
  • Daily from 8am, trains run between Berowra or Hornsby and Central, platforms 1-12 only.
  • Change at Central for City Circle trains, metro or light rail services to continue your journey.

  • Saturday from 10.50pm to 2am, buses replace trains between Hornsby and Epping.
  • Change at Epping for metro services to the City, or trains to Central, platforms 1-12.
  • Buses also replace T1 North Shore Line trains between Hornsby and Wynyard.
  • Most Central Coast & Newcastle Line trains continue to run.
  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
8T9 Hornsby, then express to Epping and return
82T9 Hornsby, then all stations to Epping and return

Check signs at stops and see the event page for more info.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Lithgow and Mount Victoria
content:
Monday 26 to Friday 30 August 
  • Buses replace trains between Lithgow and Mount Victoria.
  • Trains run between Mount Victoria and Central, some to a changed timetable.
  • Bathurst trains run between Bathurst and Lithgow or Central, to a changed timetable.

  • Friday from 9.30pm, buses replace trains from Lithgow to Blacktown.
  • The last train to Central leaves Mount Victoria at 21:01, arriving Central at 23:21.
  • From 11.50pm, buses replace trains from Blacktown to Lithgow.
  • The last train to the Blue Mountains leaves Central at 22:18, arriving Mount Victoria 00:37.
  • T1 Western Line trains run between the City and St Marys, to a changed timetable. Change at Blacktown for buses to Blue Mountains Line stations.

  • If you are travelling to Lithgow to connect with NSW TrainLink Regional Coaches, please call 132 232 to confirm departure times.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.

urlText: South Mosman Wharf: Route 111 temporary bus changes
content:
From Monday 5 August to Monday 16 September, from 6am to 4pm, Monday to Friday, there will be temporary changes to the Route 111 bus service due to construction work at South Mosman Wharf.

During this six-week period, buses will turn around on Raglan Street at the Musgrave Street intersection on weekdays from 6am-4pm only. Buses will run their usual routes on weekday afternoons, weeknights, and throughout the weekend. Private vehicles will still have full access to Musgrave Street.
  • Catch the Route 111 bus towards Military Road at the bus stop on Raglan Street at Musgrave Street (ID 2088154).
  • School buses will allow students to exit at this stop, avoiding the need to cross Raglan Street unattended.
  • Please note travel apps may not reflect these temporary changes.
Wharf closure:
  • South Mosman Wharf will be closed for around eight months to improve accessibility as part of the Safe Accessible Transport program.
  • Ferry passengers must use alternative transport options during the closure.
Alternative transport options:
  • Ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf will continue as usual.
  • To get to Mosman Bay Wharf, catch the Route 111 bus service to Canrobert Street and change to the Route 230 bus from Avenue Road, a short walk away.
    230 bus services can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
  • Please allow extra travel time and plan ahead using the Trip Planner.
subtitle: South Mosman Wharf: Route 111 temporary bus changes

Catch the Route 111 bus towards Military Road at the bus stop on Raglan Street at Musgrave Street (ID 2088154).

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst Moore Park and Kingsford are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
Route 396 services will be affected in three stages throughout the day.
  • From 4am to 10.30am buses to the city will be diverting away from Kingsford, Randwick and Moore Park via Gardeners Rd, Botany Rd, Henderson Rd, Wyndham St, Gibbons St, Lawson Sq, Regent St, Redfern St, Chalmers St, Randle St, Elizabeth St then as normal. Services towards Maroubra will divert via Redfern St, Regent St, Botany Rd, Gardeners Rd, Bunnerong Rd, then continue as normal.
  • From 10.30am to 12.30pm services towards the city will continue diverting and end trips at Central Station, Eddy Ave, Stand A (200039). Services leaving the city towards Maroubra will start trips from Central Station, Elizabeth St, Stand E (201080)
  • From 12.30pm to 2.30pm services will run resume running to and from Circular Quay but continue to divert around Oxford St via Foveaux St, Albion St, Crown St and Cleveland St.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: Sydney CBD and Pyrmont diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2pm route 389 services will be split into two routes between Pyrmont and Town Hall, and between Woolloomooloo and Bondi Junction.
  • Pyrmont-city services will not run until 9am due to road closures in Pyrmont. From 9am to 10am buses from Pyrmont will leave from Harris St at Pyrmont Bridge Rd (200916) and end trips at Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand H (2000249). Buses from Town Hall to Pyrmont will pick up from Park St Stand J (2000425) and end trips at Miller St before Harris St, (200932). Stops on Pirrama Rd will be missed.
  • Pyrmont-city from 10am to 2pm buses will run as normal through Pyrmont but end trips at Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand H (2000249). Buses from Town Hall to Pyrmont will pick up from Park St Stand J (2000425). From the city change for trains to Bondi Junction.
  • City-Bondi Jct: Buses to Bondi Junction will start trips from Crown St at Robinson St (2010100). Buses from Bondi Junction towards the city will end trips at Riley St at Kennedy St (201157). Continue on foot to Town Hall to connect with buses towards Pyrmont.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: Greenwich Point Wharf closed
content:
Monday 22 April until late 2024
 
Greenwich Point Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:
  • Use the existing 265 bus route which travels from Lane Cove to North Sydney via Greenwich, connecting with St Leonards and North Sydney train stations.
  • Additional bus services for the 265 route will be provided between Greenwich Point Wharf and Crows Nest, via St Leonards during weekdays and nights and over the weekends to offset the missing ferry services.
  • Captain Cook Cruises operates a commuter ferry service during peak travel times from Greenwich Wharf Bay Street. Please check their website for more information.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements and check information displays for service updates.
  • For more information on the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade please visit the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade page.
subtitle: Greenwich Point Wharf closed

urlText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
content:
Monday 3 June until late 2024

South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

  • Public transport options include F2 and F6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • Use the existing 111 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • The 230 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.
subtitle: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades

properties.smsText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
properties.speechText:
From Monday 3rd June until late 2024,South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

Public transport options include F 2 and F 6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
Use the existing 1 1 1 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
The 2 3 0 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.

urlText: L2 and L3 light rail services may be temporarily held at stops or partially closed due to a Police Operation
content:
L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services may be impacted between 2pm and 3pm approximately due to road closures around Town Hall for a planned Police Operation protest march:
  • L2 and L3 services may be temporarily held at stops, or
  • L2 and L3 services may be temporarily partially closed between Town Hall and Circular Quay or Central Chalmers Street.
Impact to services and timings may change at the direction of NSW Police.
 
Please check information screens at stops, listen to announcements and follow the direction of staff or Police on site, as necessary.
 
Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner for alternative transport options, including trains, buses or walking.
 
L1 Dulwich Hill Line light rail services should continue to run as per normal.

urlText: Sydney CBD & North Sydney diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 3.30am to 10am buses will start and end trips at Crows Nest instead of the city. Buses will end trips at Crows Nest station, Pacific Hwy after Oxley St (206515).
 
Buses towards Macquarie Park will start trips from Pacific Hwy opp Crows Nest Station (206530).
 
Catch metro services to continue your trip between Crows Nest and the city. Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops
  • Lang Park, York St Sydney (2000133)
  • Sussex St before Erskine St Sydney (200018)
  • Sussex St at Erskine St Sydney (200013)
  • Clarence St opp Barrack St Sydney (2000189)
  • Wynyard Station, Clarence St, Stand R Sydney (2000142)
subtitle: Sydney CBD & North Sydney diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Metro services temporarily end by 10.30pm Monday to Thursday evenings between Chatswood and Sydenham, please check service times and plan your trip
content:
For the first four weeks after opening, there are reduced operating hours from Monday to Thursday evenings in the City section between Chatswood and Sydenham to support essential engineering and maintenance works during the early phases of operations.
 
This is temporary and only affects services between Chatswood and Sydenham. Following the first four weeks, metro services will operate between Tallawong and Sydenham on the normal timetable.

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 10am, route 172X and 173X services will run between Warringah Mall and St Leonards via North Balgowlah/Balgowlah Shops only. Buses will not run to or from the city.
 
Services to Warringah Mall will start trips from Crows Nest Station, Pacific Hwy (206515) also stopping at St Leonards Station, Pacific Hwy, Stand C (206521) and along Falcon St in North Sydney.
 
Catch a train to continue your trip between St Leonards and the city.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops:
  • Wynyard Station, York St (Stand M) (200035)
  • Wynyard Station, Carrington St (Stand A) (200021)

urlText: L1 Dulwich Hill Line weeknight full closures due to maintenance
content:
From Monday 9 to Wednesday 11 September, nightly from 8pm to 1am, L1 Dulwich Hill Line light rail services will not run due to planned trackwork and maintenance works.

During this time, use alternative transport including L1 replacement bus services, regular bus services or walking if able to between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill.

L1 replacement bus services:

Nightly from 8pm to 1am, replacement bus services will run between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill.

Replacement buses will not stop at the following locations:

  • Capitol Square (towards Central and Dulwich Hill / The Star) - Please use the alternative stop at Central Grand Concourse or walk to Central Station (approx. 7 minute walk),
  • Exhibition Centre (towards Dulwich Hill / The Star) - Please use the alternative stop at Convention (approx. 7 minute walk),
  • Pyrmont Bay (towards Central and Dulwich Hill / The Star) - Please use the alternative stop at The Star (approx. 5 minute walk).

See the news story for more detailed service information.

Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner or check travel alerts to see if your travel is affected.
subtitle: L1 Dulwich Hill Line weeknight full closures due to maintenance

urlText: Buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction
content:
Monday 9 to Thursday 12 September
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction.
  • Trackwork buses do not leave from Martin Place Station.
  • Trains run between South Coast Line stations and the City Circle.
  • Change at:
    - Central for buses to Kings Cross and Edgecliff, or metro services to Martin Place
    - Town Hall for express buses to Bondi Junction

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
20T4 Bondi Junction, Edgecliff, Kings Cross, then Central and return (bypassing Martin Place)
23T4 Bondi Junction, then Town Hall and return
324/325 City, Walsh Bay to Watsons Bay via Town Hall (Park St), Kings Cross, Edgecliff stations and return
333 City to Bondi Beach via Martin Place and Bondi Junction stations and return

urlText: Chatswood bus diversions for StreetFair
content:
• Saturday 7 September

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 15 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 3.30am to 10am buses will start and end trips at Crows Nest instead of North Sydney. Buses will end trips at Crows Nest Station, Pacific Hwy Crows Nest (206515). Buses towards Chatswood will start trips from Crows Nest Station, Pacific Hwy Crows Nest (206515).
 
Stops at Wynyard, and QVB will be missed. Change for metro or train services to continue your trip between Crows Nest and the city.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport details.

urlText: T1 Western Line: Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown
content:
Monday 9 to Thursday 12 September
  • Nightly from 10pm to 4.10am, buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown.
  • Trains run between Blacktown and the City, some to a changed timetable.

  • Tuesday to Thursday, the 03:09 and 03:42 trains from Emu Plains to Blacktown will also be replaced by buses.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
1BM  Springwood, then all stations to Penrith, then Blacktown and return
8AT1 Penrith, then Emu Plains and return
71T1 Penrith, then express to Blacktown and return
72T1 Penrith, then all stations to Blacktown and return
